Description: Ostracon, fragment of the body of a buff-coloured pottery vessel, the fabric is partially grey in section, the interior is thickly encrusted with a yellow-brown resinous deposit, the exterior is covered with a self-slip and remains of a red-painted cursive text, now partly obscured by a granular deposit.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (394275) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/394275)
